subtitle: A hint of lemon and fresh mint contrast with rich lamb in this easy-to-make main course.

method.text: Cut bread into small cubes. Place in a bowl. Pour over the milk, Stir. Leave to soak for 10 min.
Put the lamb into a large bowl with the onion, lemon rind and seasoning. Add the soaked bread. Mix well. Shape mixture into small balls.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Fry the meatballs for 5 min, carefully turning over until well browned all over. Remove the meatballs with a slotted spoon. Drain well on kitchen paper. Tip away the fat. Wipe the pan clean.

Pour the stock and lemon juice into the pan. Return the meatballs to the pan. Bring to the boil. Cover. Simmer gently for 10 min. Add the salad onions and beans. Cook for 15 min. Remove meatballs with a slotted spoon. Keep warm.
Blend the cornflour with a little cold water to make a runny paste. Stir into the pan juices. Simmer, stirring constantly, for 1 min until thickened.
Remove from the heat. Stir in the yogurt and chopped mint. Season to taste. Return meatballs to the sauce. Heat gently until piping hot.

title: Greek meatballs
